refnamediv.refpurpose: add a witness node's information to the &repmgr; metadata

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: repmgr witness register adds a witness server's node record to the &repmgr; metadata, and if necessary initialises the witness node by installing the &repmgr; extension and copying the &repmgr; metadata to the witness server. This command needs to be executed to enable use of the witness server with &repmgrd;.
When executing repmgr witness register, database connection information for the cluster primary server must also be provided.

In most cases it's only necessary to provide the primary's hostname with the -h/--host option; &repmgr; will automatically use the user and dbname values defined in the conninfo string defined in the witness node's repmgr.conf, unless these are explicitly provided as command line options.

note.para: The primary server must be registered with repmgr primary register before the witness server can be registered.

refsect1.para: Execute with the --dry-run option to check what would happen without actually registering the witness server.

para.programlisting: $ repmgr -f /etc/repmgr.conf witness register -h node1 INFO: connecting to witness node "node3" (ID: 3) INFO: connecting to primary node NOTICE: attempting to install extension "repmgr" NOTICE: "repmgr" extension successfully installed INFO: witness registration complete NOTICE: witness node "node3" (ID: 3) successfully registered
